private_information: There are six high-level actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Predicates appearing in rules include hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, collect, spring, stupendous.

Action preconditions and effects summary available for inspection: paltry requires hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2; paltry makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes vase object_0 object_1 false; sip requires hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2; sip makes vase object_0 object_1 true and makes next object_0 object_2 false; clip requires hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2; clip makes vase object_0 object_1 true and makes next object_0 object_2 false; wretched requires sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3; wretched makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes next object_0 object_1 false; memory requires cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1; memory makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes next object_0 object_1 false; tightfisted requires hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1; tightfisted makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes vase object_0 object_1 false.
analyst.goal: Support generation of a consistent plan to achieve the goal facts next object_10 object_6, next object_11 object_7, next object_12 object_7, next object_9 object_6.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties.
You check for hidden dependencies, inconsistent renamings, and post hoc fixes that would allow illegal transitions.
You ensure effects that flip facts are causally justified and identify missing linking facts needed to chain actions safely.
auditor.goal: Produce an audit report that identifies temporal ordering constraints, removed bookkeeping shortcuts, and provides corrected causal links for the planning model.

private_information: You integrate analysis and audit outputs to create a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver.
Keep agent actions distinct and ensure the PDDL is consumable by FastDownwards without relying on bookkeeping shortcuts.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and problem that achieve next object_10 object_6, next object_11 object_7, next object_12 object_7, and next object_9 object_6 when solved by FastDownwards.

public_information: Objects present include object_0 through object_12 and other indexes referenced in initial conditions.

Initial predicate facts include cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_9, next object_0 object_7, next object_10 object_8, next object_11 object_5, next object_12 object_6, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_7, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8.
Available actions are paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with the preconditions and effects known to the analyst.
Global goal facts are next object_10 object_6, next object_11 object_7, next object_12 object_7, next object_9 object_6.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert analyst of symbolic action schemata. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a structured analysis describing constraints, required link facts, possible variable bindings across objects, and candidate action sequences that respect provided preconditions and effects. Identify ambiguities and name-mapping issues if objects seem to refer to the same role.
analysis.prompt: Agent analyst receives the public information and its private information and the global goal. Produce a structured analysis that lists for each action the minimal binding patterns to move 'next' relations among the object indices in the initial facts to reach the goal. Do not produce PDDL.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor focused on temporal and causal consistency and on removing bookkeeping shortcuts. Do not emit PDDL. Inspect the analysis report and the public information. Identify any use of quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or implicit shortcuts, and propose corrections as explicit causal links and ordering constraints. Output a clear list of required ordering constraints and any removed bookkeeping shortcuts.
audit.prompt: Agent auditor receives the analyst analysis and the public information and its private information and the global goal. Produce an audit report that lists temporal ordering constraints, any removed bookkeeping shortcuts, corrected causal dependencies, and explicit linking predicates that must be introduced or enforced so that a planner cannot rely on illicit shortcuts. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert at creating multi-agent PDDL domains and problems suitable for the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the analyst's structured analysis and the auditor's corrections. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that explicitly encode the actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted, objects as typed constants if helpful, initial facts as provided, and the goal facts. Ensure no bookkeeping shortcuts remain. Keep agent actions distinct if agent-specific effects are necessary. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility.
pddl.prompt: Agent orchestrator receives the analyst analysis and the auditor audit report and the public information and its private information and the global goal. Integrate inputs and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards, with domain and problem enclosed in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> respectively.
